quantspace 0.1.0
  • Reference

Compute quantile regressions via quantile spacings

qs.Rd

Compute quantile regressions via quantile spacings

qs(
  formula,
  data = NULL,
  quantiles = c(0.9, 0.75, 0.5, 0.25, 0.1),
  baseline_quantile = 0.5,
  calc_se = T,
  se_method = "subsample",
  weight_vec = NULL,
  subsample_percent = 0.2,
  algorithm = "sfn",
  cluster_formula = NULL,
  num_bs = 100,
  parallel = TRUE,
  num_cores = getCores(),
  trunc = T,
  small = NULL,
  seed = NULL,
  draw_weights = NULL,
  sampling_method = NULL,
  output_quantiles = T,
  calc_avg_me = F,
  lambda = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

formula

an object of class "formula" (or one that can be coerced to that class): a symbolic description of the model to be fitted.
data

an optional data frame, list or environment (or object coercible by as.data.frame to a data frame) containing the variables in the model. If not found in data, the variables are taken from environment(formula)
quantiles

vector of quantiles to be estimated
baseline_quantile

baseline quantile to measure spacings from (defaults to 0.5)
calc_se

boolean, whether or not to calculate standard errors
se_method

Method to use for standard errors, either "weighted_bootstrap", "subsample", "bootstrap" or "resample_qs" along with a specified subsampling method and subsample percent.
weight_vec

vector of weights for weighted quantile regression
subsample_percent

percent to subsample for standard error calculations
algorithm

What algorithm to use for fitting underlying regressions. Either one of "sfn", "br", "lasso" or a function name which estimates quantiles
cluster_formula

formula (e.g. ~X1 + X2) giving the clustering formula
num_bs

number of bootstrap draws
parallel

whether to run bootstrap in parallel
num_cores

number of cores to use (defaults to setting from `getOption(mc.cores)`)
trunc

whether to truncate small values
small

level of "small" values to guarentee numerical stability
seed

what seed to use for replicable RNG
draw_weights

whether to use random exponential weights for bootstrap
sampling_method

One of "leaveRows", "subsampleRows", or "bootstrapRows". leaveRows doesn't resample rows at all. subsampleRows samples without replacement given some percentage of the data (specified via subsample_percent), and boostrapRows samples with replacement.
output_quantiles

whether to save fitted quantiles as part of the function output
calc_avg_me

whether to return average marginal effects as part of the fitted object
lambda

optional penalty parameter, ignored except for penalized quantile regressions
...

additional arguments, ignored for now
